name: treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting | waste paper, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9517/documentation

Personal communication with the European Paper & Pulp Industry, together with information from literature, is used in order to establish the dataset.  All waste is assumed to be incinerated. The dataset represents the input material for DIP process, as delivered to the factory gate.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This module includes the efforts for sorting collected paper (energy, materials), the treatment of the waste fractions extracted plus the subsequent transport to a paper production site.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from the European Paper & Pulp industry, used as European average
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: typical technology used in Europe arround 2005
